snippet: Commissioner William J. Bratton told police commanders that while the vast majority of officers did their jobs well, those who did not were “not the right fit” for the department.
abstract: New York Police Commissioner William J Bratton tells New York Police Dept commanders that gains against crime are being undercut by its most troublesome police officers, and they must be rooted out; comments are Bratton's most forceful public remarks on police misconduct since Eric Garner died in police custody in July after he was approached for selling loose cigarettes.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner William J. Bratton told police commanders that while the vast majority of officers did their jobs well, those who did not were “not the right fit” for the department.

headline.main: Bratton Says New York Police Dept. Must Dismiss Bad Officers
headline.print_headline: Bratton Says Police Dept. Must Dismiss Officers Who Are ‘Poisoning the Well’
